meanings.sent1: The dog left a jobbie on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: I had to clean up the jobbie my cat left in the litter box.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally stepped on a jobbie while walking in the park.
meanings.sent4: The jobbie in the toilet looked like a tiny brown rock.
meanings.sent5: The jobbie smelled really bad and made me gag.

meanings.definition: A task or piece of work, especially one that is considered unpleasant or boring.
meanings.sent1: Cleaning the garage was such a jobbie.
meanings.sent2: I have a lot of jobbies to finish before the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: Doing laundry is my least favorite jobbie around the house.
meanings.sent4: The jobbie of organizing my closet felt never-ending.
meanings.sent5: The jobbie of mowing the lawn under the scorching sun was exhausting.
